intro: Dendromyza staufferi, commonly known as the Stauffer's dendromyza, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
